results.webTitle: Rangers head into daunting Old Firm match with shaky hands on the tiller

results.firPara: While Leroy Sané, Yaya Touré, David Silva and Sergio Agüero jostled for Manchester Citys man-of-the-match award, Brad Guzans status as Middlesbroughs outstanding individual brooked absolutely no argument.
results.secPara: Aitor Karankas goalkeeper performed wonders to keep the scoreline respectable on a day when Pep Guardiolas side warmed up for Wednesdays Champions League trip to Monaco by extending their unbeaten run to 11 games as they coasted into the semi-finals.
results.webTitle: Manchester City and David Silva catch Middlesbrough cold to reach semi

results.firPara: David Silva and Sergio Aguero scored to give a slick City an easy victory over a toothless Middlesbrough
results.secPara: Peep peep! City ease into the semi-finals with a quietly emphatic victory over Middlesbrough. David Silvas early goal pretty much decided the match; Sergio Agueros second-half goal confirmed it was all over. Thanks for your company, bye.
results.webTitle: Middlesbrough 0-2 Manchester City: FA Cup quarter-final – as it happened

results.firPara: • I want to offer them the potential to be first-team players here
results.secPara: • I want to offer them the potential to be first-team players here
results.webTitle: Mauricio Pochettino prefers to have Tottenham talent at home, not on loan

results.firPara: Brighton and Hove Albion eased past Derby County to win 3-0 and move level on points with Newcastle United at the top of the Championship.
results.secPara: The Seagulls eighth home league win out of 10 stretched the gap between them and third-placed Huddersfield to nine points, although the Terriers have two games in hand.
results.webTitle: Brighton ease past Derby to move level on points with leaders Newcastle

results.firPara: Norwich City have terminated Alex Neils contract, bringing an end to the 35-year-old managers two-year reign at Carrow Road.
results.secPara: The first-team coach, Alan Irvine, will take charge for Saturdays home game against Blackburn Rovers.
results.webTitle: Norwich sack Alex Neil as manager with club off Championship promotion pace

results.firPara: Antonio Conte will not tone down his touchline exuberance when Chelsea renew hostilities with Manchester United on Monday night despite José Mourinho accusing the Italian of trying to humiliate him when the teams met in October.
results.secPara: Mourinho was less than impressed with the way his replacement at Stamford Bridge behaved when the league leaders thrashed United at Stamford Bridge. Facing his old side for the first time since his sacking in December 2015, Mourinho was infuriated by Conte whipping up the home support after NGolo Kanté made it 4-0 to Chelsea. Uniteds manager, speaking in Italian, appeared to tell Conte he should behave like that at 1-0, not at 4-0 and backroom staff of both clubs clashed in the tunnel after the final whistle.
results.webTitle: Antonio Conte will stay exuberant when Chelsea face Manchester United

results.firPara: The prospect of safe standing being introduced to English football has moved a step closer after the government body responsible for ground safety granted a request from the Football League to permit rail seating in 21 grounds that are not subject to all-seater requirements.
results.secPara: A letter sent by the Football Leagues chief executive, Shaun Harvey, to clubs this week, which has been seen by the Guardian, revealed that the Sports Grounds Safety Authority has agreed to establish a process whereby rail seating such as the type used in Germanys Bundesliga and at Celtic Park can be introduced.
results.webTitle: Safe standing a step closer after Football League’s green light for rail seats

results.firPara: In todays Fiver Lincoln City, Dimitri Payets pleasure and Harry Kanes chef

results.webTitle: The Fiver | Football careers given a helping hand from Messrs Collis and Orosco

results.firPara: As befits a man with an apparently inbuilt resistance to compromise and suspicion of delegation, Aitor Karanka does not really do shades of grey. His horribly goal-shy Middlesbrough side are preparing for an FA Cup quarter-final at home to Manchester City at a moment when they have dropped into the Premier Leagues bottom three and gone 10 league games without a win.
results.secPara: As awkward questions about his job security intensify and the postponement of Saturdays scheduled relegation six-pointer against Sunderland at the Riverside threatens to leave Boro playing league catch up, Karanka might have been expected to view the Cup as something of a poisoned chalice.
results.webTitle: Middlesbrough tensions on back burner after Aitor Karanka clears the air
